from documenation i found that ,
for showing data at contact timeline , need to add the same in the contact eventTemplate .
Like this you can see in detail template
Right click on the folder in design manager and select copy to different portal option. is this answer your question ?
Is HubSpot deal with association of one eventTemplate with another eventTemplate  in contact timeline apis ?
How can I reset form data on form submit in HubSpot portal ?
So that is working for you?

yes
thankyou jaydip
Yep .
Does anybody know if <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-quickstart> can be used with custom objects? Would I reference the internal name in the .json files?

<@U04UF7BNBK4> Yes, it can be used on custom objects. Just define the object using the `fullyQualified` name, if that does not work try p_{`internalname`}

```// Example extension config file

{
  "type": "crm-card",
  "data": {
    "title": "Example Card",
    "location": "crm.record.tab",
    "uid": "unique-extension-name",
    "module": {
      "file": "Example.jsx"
    },
    "objectTypes": [{ "name": "p_cars" }]
  }
}```
Thanks a lot <@U02P3JPAV3Q>!

Hi guys I just sent via api a custom behavioral event. The call goes to 204, but I don't see anything in the portal. I used to do the same thing a while ago and it works, is there a downtime or something?

GET*`/crm/v3/schemas`*

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>
hey federico! did you create the event in the UI first

Good Afternoon Everyone,
I need to create a worker that downloads all associations for all of my objects.
I could not find a endpoint that does that.

Has anyone dealt with this before? Any suggestions?

If anyone else has a similar question, the answer is that they will need to convert on the website to trigger the relevant cookies first to be able to see the smart content, regardless of if they are already in the CRM or not.
I don’t think there is such an endpoint

Thanks for the answer <@U039PUBV59N>
For testing the endpoint i was trying to create an custom object by using POST `/crm/v3/schemas`
but its throwing me `Missing Scope` message with status `403` .
```{"status":"error","message":"The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum.","correlationId":"fa71adf7-5944-4fbb-91ec-e40abe95cc87","links":{"support":"<https://help.HubSpot.com/>","forum":"<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations>"},"category":"MISSING_SCOPES"}```
Here is the scopes set.
If you kindly help me in this that will be huge. Thank you!
I think i need to upgrade my account to use the custom objects staff.

If anyone knows the answer to this question, it would be appreciated.
We are planning to call each of the following APIs. Which authorization scope is required to use each API?
• <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/get-account-details>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-information-api>
Also, where can I find the authorizations required to use the APIs?
“Authority scope” refers to “crm.objects.deals.read,” etc.

It was confirmed in the area corresponding to the red frame in the following capture.
This question is closed.
